answers.answer: I forgot to mention...Today going back to work from the Doc's office I noticed my leg was burning where the sun was hitting it.  When I got back to work I went to use the restroom and noticed a red rash in the area that was exposed to sun and I also felt hot around my neck and arms...I look there and those areas are also reddish.  I know this could be some sort of side effect from sun and depression meds but I also know there is a rash associated with ARS or HIV.  Today is the first day I have seen this happen though....And I am SO tired of going to the Doctors!  I have been so much in the last month...I just really need to hear some opinions, about all my things going on, please!
Had the condom failed you would have known. Your oral thrush is not ARS nor is your rash.

Hey Teak...Thank you for your reply.  How reliable are the tests out to 4 1/2 to 5 months?And I do not know if you would know this but...IF the HIV tests I have had are reliable then what should I be checking for with this recurring oral thrush?
3 months post exposure is conclusive so anything longer than that would also be conclusive. As for thrush see your doctor or dentist.
